title: MacBook Pro 15" Touch Bar 2017 A1707 AutoBoot turned off
message:
Hello guys,

I hope someone can help me with this. 

A MacBook Pro 15" Touch Bar 2017 came in contact with honey! The whole right side was affected. I opened it, cleaned up the mess, ordered a new audio jack, a speaker and a right fan. I also noticed that the power button was erratic but at least I could start it up by plugging in the charger. I gave the macbook back to the customer to use until the parts arrived.

When the parts arrived, I foolishly took iFixit advice and disabled Auto Boot feature in terminal: s[B]udo nvram AutoBoot=%00. [/B]I replaced the parts and now I cannot turn it on! Opening the lid, plugging in the charger or pressing the power button (whenever it decides to work) result in the same: fan spin for a couple of seconds and then dead.

What now?

title: MacBook Pro 15" Touch Bar 2017 A1707 AutoBoot turned off
message: Disconnect battery, plug it in again and try plugging power to usb-c again

title: MacBook Pro 15" Touch Bar 2017 A1707 AutoBoot turned off
message: So stupid, so simple... you are my savior. Thank you brunomotter! Case closed.

title: MacBook Pro 15" Touch Bar 2017 A1707 AutoBoot turned off
message:
Can't seem to find the forum. 

Also, is there a reason why the mac won't auto boot when i open the lead or plug the power cable in?

title: MacBook Pro 15" Touch Bar 2017 A1707 AutoBoot turned off
message:
Check system preferencies.

All iCore platforms should start when the charger is connected, if no battery present.
Of course, if power charger is correct model, expected by machine!
